title: It works but beware of how they make money and their outdated system
text: I've used WU for probably 15 years both in person and online sending.  The $ gets there but you need to know:If you can send from and into your currency, you'll lose less money - not only are you paying their fee either way, but their exchange rate is WAY below market so you lose $$$ if you can't keep it in the same currency.  Once "lost" a HUGE percentage and they explained it was getting "exchanged" multiple times: once from USD to local to arrive at bank, then back to USD then back to local again (for what reason I do not understand but that's messed up).In person will always give you less issues and generally lower fees.The reason for this post is I keep being giving errors when using my bank account to send now (won't work with checking or savings despite using the manual input and reviewing it's all correct).  This is forcing me to pay more than double to use my debit card associated with the same bank account instead.  The online system also won't let me start a new transfer from scratch, I have to use the "quick resend" of an old transfer.  The system is clearly old and bugging.  Costing time and money every time.  So be aware, if you can go in person it'll take a few minutes but give you less of a headache, and always keep it in your home currency if possible to avoid loss on their exchange rates.

title: Decently easy to transfer.
text: For the most part, sending money to someone with Western Union has been relatively easy. However, my receiver is now unable to receive money through local pickup. The Western Union partner they were going to, to receive the money, started to refuse them service because I wasn't sending more than $1000 at a time. They stated that anything less than $1000 wasn't acceptable because it's "too little" of money. I have since started transferring using the bank transfer option, and other than taking up to 7 business days, it has been ok. I don't see anything on the Western Union website about needing a certain amount for a local pickup, so just be mindful, your receiver may not be able to accept your money via local pickup unless you're sending over $1000 at a time.

text: It is very often a problem with banks in Bosnia and Herzegovina, especially if the amounts are biger than 500 Euros. In 50% of cases, banks say that the system does not work, some only work for two hours/day in the morning or in the afternoon, if you don't come at that time they refuse you (there is no notification anywhere when they work). Last case Monday 05/08/2024 GradacacBosnia and Herzegovina, 5 banks rejected me, in the end I had to cancel WU (losing fee) and withdraw mony at the ATM (+5Euro and sepa cost of minimum 15Euro for 100 Euro....). The reason why banks refuse is the commission of 5 Euros they receive during ATM withdrawals until they can earn it with WU. Therefore, WU needs to decide which banks it will work with and which it will not. The problem make banks , not WU, and the banks sistem in Bosnia is one big mafia, and 4 time expencive then in Germany

title: Western Union used to be top flight
text: Western Union used to be top flight. I have been a customer for many years and was never anything but pleased. Until now.Now it's becoming clear that they actually don't really do international transfers. Instead they just put your transaction "under review" and leave it sit there endlessly, before finally rejecting the transaction. It seems likely that they use that money, times the thousands of people they do it to, to invest in the daily float and earn interest. They are, in effect, loaning themselves a great deal of money, interest-free and making money on it. Deplorable.In this case, it took three tries to get it to actually go through, with identical specs each time.This is not the Western Union I remember, and I mourn the old one.

title: Your service is good but you need a proper customer verifications system
text: Your service is nice and I have used it since 2007 when you had no online transfer service. Since I registered with the online service in 2017, I have never used any other money transfer service in my life. I have always recommend your service to other friends.However, I still don't like your inability to scrutinize customers based on previous transaction history. In other words,  you have no way of familiarizing yourself with outstanding customers. Or, perhaps, you have a policy that treats certain customers based on their names or places of origin. For example,  you disappointed me in June 2023 when I attempted to use your service during my visit to Guinea,  Konakry. You turned down my transfer simply because it was in an unusual country. You left me stranded financially. I expected you to try a concrete verification mechanism to know if it was really me or not.  I guess you only depend on online call centers or robots who only work with precoded instructions. You have done similar miscalculations on several occasions. I always wondered whether it was due to mistrust in certain people in certain countries or Western Union is simply  unreliable. You re not a banker but you should be able to act like the banks. They reach out to us when they sense unusual activities in our accounts.The link between you and Klarna sometimes fails. It has happened to me quite a few times.  It attempts to reroute without success. The above re my candid  opinions.

title: I was deeply appreciative of the app's…
text: I was deeply appreciative of the app's generosity, particularly during the onset of conflict in Ukraine, where my heart lies with cherished relatives. The decision by Western Union to waive fees at the beginning of the war was a profound act of compassion. However, my sentiment has shifted due to the recent reimplementation of fees, which has left me disheartened.The app's user-friendly interface has always made it a reliable choice for sending aid to those in need. Yet, the reappearance of fees, especially during such turbulent times, feels like a step backward. It's disheartening to witness this reversal, as it undermines the very essence of humanitarian aid and support.While I understand the operational costs involved, the timing of this fee reintroduction feels unfortunate, particularly when the need for assistance in Ukraine is more urgent than ever. I hope that Western Union reconsiders this decision and finds alternative ways to support users during times of crisis, ensuring that the app remains a beacon of hope and assistance for those in need.

title: I appreciate the good rates but the security is lacking multifactor authentication.
text: I appreciate the good rates but the service lacks basic security, there is no option to enable multifactor authentication. Due to a past account compromise I removed my debit card as a precaution, since that allows for instant irreversible transfers, just in case it ever happened again. WU support did NOT help me get any money back and again does NOT have any basic two factor authentication that can be enabled, which is shocking from a financial institution in the year 2024. It would be highly advisable to at least make this feature an option, if not enforced, on everyone's accounts.

My advice would be to make it easier to contact WU customer service using an app like whatsapp so we do not have to spend so much money while waiting on hold.  We would be more than happy to send copies of both out passport and marriage certificate if this made transfers easier.  I fully understand that you have to comply with each country's anti money laundering laws and tax laws.  We will continue to use WU in the future but will not rely on it as our sole source to transfer money.  We recently used remitly and it did cost a little more than WU and the app isn't as nice.

title: My name is Hense Elysee
text: My name is Hense Elysee, working as a Customer Service at Olympus / Evident Scientific in Massachusetts. I do customer service also in MA.I like Western Union, and use it 95% to send money for friends and family, but I do not like your customer service at all. Many times, I have used the Promo Code points for a transfer.#1) When I select $15.00 to pay for my transfer, the Promo Code # does not appear. Promo Code has been selected by me, but I do not know where is the info.#2) Earlier, I have selected enough point to redeem $15.00, when I call your customer Service, today for example, your customer service told me that I can only redeem $12.00, even though I select enough point to redeem $ 15.00. I use enough points for $15.00 and I get a Promo Code for $12.00. I do not understand it.I have to tell also, I have lost a lot of point, but I did not bother to call your customer service.When select promo Code with valid points, the information should be prompted somewhere to be seen.At final, if the points are mine, why can't have up to 3 promo code numbers at once, if I want to have 3 transfers. Why do I have to call customer service 3 times for 3 transfers, while they can be done once.The Promo Code should be reevaluated and make it easy for customers to use. Also, I have lost a lot of points for many years. I hope when I select points for $15.00 and found it worth $12.00.       Thank you.       An unhappy customer.

title: From Good To Bad
text: Overall, the process is simple and efficient for overseas transfers. However, both browser and app are a bit slow and I've lost several fee rewards in the process. This is from someone who conducts 2-3 transfers a month abroad. While WU is entitled to make money in both transfer fees and exchange rates, they should simplify the rewards program by allowing their customers an automatic option to use the rewards they've earned.Update (09/03/23) Typically, the money I send overseas reaches the receiver's bank in 30 minutes. After two days, the money still had not arrived. I contacted WU's customer service and was told that it was not sent due to insufficient funds (a total fabrication). When I called WU back with the date, time and my transaction number from my bank account, the story changed to a glitch in the process and the funds would be arriving Monday, a full 3 days later. Completely unacceptable and if this happens again... I'm done.
